avalancheActivity.comment: Few small slabs released in Hengill area in westerly aspects. Snowgroomer triggerd a small slab with cornice collapse in Bláfjöll
avalancheActivity.highlights: Considerable amount of new snow from late december, that has been transported and is starting to settle. Few small slabs released in Hengill area W-aspect.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Considerable amount of new snow from late desember that has been transported and is starting to settle. Windslabs and loose snow in the area. Few small slabs released in Hengill area in westerly aspects. Weeklayers could exist where older snow is underneath or within windslabs/new snow. Moist or wet snow but dry at mountain tops. Snow should gain strength next days.

travelAdvisory.comment: Avalanches were recorded in all parts during warming on January 1st and 2nd. Most of them in the Eastfjords where the precipitation intensity was highest. Warnings were cancelled for the East fjords on the morning of January 3rd. Temperatures went above freezing in higher elevations in the East fjords. In North Iceland large avalanches released during the warming but wind slabs may still be present in upper elevations where dry snow is present. People traveling in steep terrain are advised to practice conservative terrain choices.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Avalanches were recorded in all parts during warming on January 1st and 2nd. Most in the Eastfjords where the precipitation intensity was highest. Warnings have been removed.

weatherForecast.highlights: Austlæg átt og einhver él til fjalla. Milt í veðri.

avalancheActivity.comment: Many avlanches more then a week ago but no recent reports of avalanche activity.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has started to settle but fresh windslabs expected in westerly aspects. Moist or wet snow at lower elevation.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Considerable amount new snow came in NE winds about a week ago and a few dry slabs fell. Snowpit from Seljalandsdalur showed layered windslab and a weekness at about 60 cm depth. Snow should gain strength next days.

travelAdvisory.comment: Avalanches were recorded in all parts during warming on January 1st and 2nd. Most of them in the Eastfjords where the precipitation intensity was highest. Warnings were cancelled for the East fjords on the morning of January 3rd. Temperatures went above freezing in higher elevations in the East fjords. In North Iceland large avalanches released during the warming but wind slabs may still be present in upper elevations where dry snow is present. People traveling in steep terrain are advised to practice conservative terrain choices.

weatherForecast.highlights: A-átt of einhver él til fjalla, milt í veðri og hiti nokkrar gráður á láglendi og um frostmark í hæstu fjöllum á spásvæðinu

avalancheActivity.comment: Large avalanches were recorded in Skíðadalur on January 2nd and likely released due to warming on 1st and 2nd of January. A size 2.5 avalanche was likely released by snowmobilers in Hólsdalur on Dec 30th. An avalanche was reported on S aspect in Ólafsfjörður Dec 31st. Another large avalanche, size 3.5 was released on SW facing aspect in Hestskarðshnjúkur on Dec 30th as well as a few smaller ones.
avalancheActivity.highlights: On Monday and Tuesday warming reached up to around 600 m and has affected the snow, and avalanches released in the region. Above 600 m, the snow is still dry and wind slabs have formed in snow showers. Persistant weakness can be found in the snow pack in upper elecations.

snowpackStructure.highlights: On Monday and Tuesday warming reached up to around 600 m and has affected the snow, forming a crust in mid elevations. Above 600 m, the snow is dry and wind slabs have formed in snow showers and persistant weakness can be found in the snow pack in upper elecations. Wind slabs have formed since in most aspects after significant snowing recently, mostly in S and W aspects. Cold temperatures in the last days of the year may have stimulated the growth of facets in the snow pack. Subsequent warming in the beginning of the year up to 5-600 m has impacted and likely strengthened the snow pack and decreased temperature gradient. Colder temperatures in the next days may encourage facet growth and higher temperature gradient.

travelAdvisory.comment: Avalanches were recorded in all parts during warming on January 1st and 2nd. Most of them in the Eastfjords where the precipitation intensity was highest. Warnings were cancelled for the East fjords on the morning of January 3rd. Temperatures went above freezing in higher elevations in the East fjords. In North Iceland large avalanches released during the warming but wind slabs may still be present in upper elevations where dry snow is present. People traveling in steep terrain are advised to practice conservative terrain choices.

weatherForecast.highlights: Á fimmtudag má búast við éljagangi í hægri austanátt á svæðinu. Kólnar áfram fram að helgi.

avalancheActivity.comment: Many wet slabs (size 2-3) in a avalanche cycle 1.-2. of jan. Most released at around 400-500 m elevation and westerly aspects.
avalancheActivity.highlights: A lot of new snow in the mountains but rain in lower elevations. Dry snow high in mountains, chances of wet avalanches on Thursday

snowpackStructure.highlights: Considerable amount of new snow came during NE-E storm 1.-2. of jan. Thaw and rain has wettened the snow but less effects are at higher elevations. Old firn/crust after melt/freeze cycle before xmas in some places under the new snow and many wet slabs seem to have released on this layer in a avalance cycle 1.-2. of jan. Snowpit from Oddsskarð showed some facets below the crust.

weatherForecast.highlights: Spáð smá NA-snjókomu til fjalla en rigningu neðan til. Minnkandi úrkoma á miðvikudag. Fremur milt en hlýnar með skammvinnri austan rigningu fimmtudagskvöld en snjokomu til fjalla.
